Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by suggesting that President Obama has announced he will refuse to leave office if Donald Trump is elected President. This is not supported by any credible evidence.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a satirical article from The Burrard Street Journal, which is known for publishing fictional content. There is no factual basis or credible source to support the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that President Obama has found a loophole that would allow him to remain in office if Donald Trump is elected. However, this assumption is not backed by any evidence or credible sources.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the claim is a satirical article meant to tap into the paranoia and conspiracy theories surrounding incumbent presidents and their unwillingness to leave office. The claim serves as a spoof of such conspiracist mentality.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that President Obama has never made any public statement or announcement indicating that he would refuse to leave office if Donald Trump is elected.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting the satirical article as a factual statement, without clearly indicating its fictional nature. This can mislead readers into believing the claim to be true.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
